column4: Tried reinstalling it and then 'sudo usplash' to test it, but all I get is a black screen.
tried reinstalling it but still only get a black screen (and no usplash shown on boot - just textmode)
try modifying the splash screen to something, also check /boot/grub/menu.lst and make sure it says quiet on the kernel line
the boot logo is a boot option and is not compiled into the kernel.
Why then IS there a bootlogo option you can choose when choosing what to enable in the kernel?
add    quiet     to the boot option
Boot logo - I didn't mean the Usplash but the Tux penguin that shows up during TEXT BOOT with framebuffer enabled in some kernels. But obviously not in the ubuntu generic compile.
oh, i know what you mean. not sure
did you md5 test the iso before you burned it? Did you burn as slowly as you could
Did not do that no, but the same CD worked just fine booting on my computer.
ok then a ram check is useful. Or some boot options
more power doesn't mean more compatible
it may need 64bit although technically 32bit should work. You need 64bit or 32bit+pae to address 8gb ram
i'd grab the 64bit iso and burn it after md5 checking it
